bow: when you are the toxic parent lately have noticed myself repeating many of the damaging things my own mother did does to me and not only do hate myself for it but can see it having an effect on my child behavior practicing mindfulness as best as can and mostly ve been doing good job managing my behavior towards my son but on days like today where ca stop him from pulling my hair or nearly breaking my nose with his headbutting find myself screaming lot and wanting to spank his butt ve spanked him once in the last months and regret it he by the way every link on google deals with what to do when your parents are toxic but what do you do when you re the toxic one do want to mess my baby boy up emotionally because ca control my temper same just keep trying maybe look up conscious discipline we took class in that and it was helpful come from an abusive background and the yelling is definitely the hardest practicing adjusting my tone in the opposite extreme and whispering instead it more powerful you and your child both feel that it different and it less jarring what always reminds me to adjust my behavior though is my daughter if she does something hurtful say don like it when you because it makes me feel so she has taken this modeling and tells me don like it when you yell because it makes me feel scared ve had rough day with my son and did raise my voice once and my year old said this to me kept me on track the rest of the night think being aware of your behavior is the first step in changing it if you know what you want to change fix you re that much closer personally listen to lot of podcasts and found the book how to talk so little kids will listen incredibly helpful also know this is really popular trendy advice but self care is important if you can go away for the weekend or do something extravagant make sure you re skipping chores one night week to just do something that makes you happy so you can be better mom give yourself bit of break first off all worrying that you are toxic parent is good sign that either you aren as much as you think or that there is room to grow and by the way who can hold their frustration when little thing with rock hard head smashes into your nose use to get mad when my daughter with super clammy hands would hold my hair like she had to protect it from the hounds of hell you re human too worry about my temper and if do lose it on the kids will apologize to them for example mommy was upset because of insert behaviour however it was not ok for me to scream and apologize for that then we agree to both work on said behaviours when you cut yourself some slack and rectify the situation you will find yourself less on edge and more likely to check your temper it won be perfect and you will have set backs but hey it learning process you will get there ve working through similar struggles with my temper one thing that has helped is the thought that it better for my kid year old for him to see me work through my emotions than for me to lose it or even separate myself from him although putting yourself in time out is possibility if you re on the brink of doing damage so if he is doing xyz that just snapped my last nerve in the moment between stopping him and unleashing my reaction on him let him see me getting mad but breathing it out and processing my anger towards more gentle reaction ll even narrate what feeling and how know should react want him to know there better way to handle irritation and it also frees me from feeling like an out of control failure for not being perfectly poised but instead having to visibly struggle sometimes there well known parenting course called circle of security that great for folks in this situation also ve heard good things about the book parenting from the inside out honestly so grateful to have had couple of years of therapy with psychologist highly recommend that kind of support if it at all available to you come from an abusive background and find my temper is often an issue am totally honest with my daughter that ca always control the way feel and behave and when tell at her that it not her fault sit her down once ve calmed down and explain that what did was wrong and that sorry basically put myself in the misbehaving toddler seat what would do if saw my kid say something mean or hit someone would tell her it okay to feel angry but it not okay to yell at or hurt others so treat myself the same way in front of her mommy made mistake am incredibly sorry and will try my best to do better it really paid off now that she older find she very good at explaining her emotions and where she coming from vs her cousins it really hard to be weak toxic and be aware of it just keep trying swear you will improve and you ll both be okay few months ago finished nurturing parent program that did really want to do but friend of mine was leading it for the first time and she needed people involved in it to get the hang of it wanted to argue and disagree with so much just based on how was raised one of the first things we learned and had to evaluate was how we were brought up and how it affected us and our relationship with our parents that was huge eye opener was planning on being mom but ca put that on my daughter she did ask to be here being stay at home mom was never part of my plan but that not her fault yes have my moments when want to scream and use the same discipline techniques grew up with but living in fear of my mom till hit point was no longer afraid and actively did things she would have never let me do was point that really stood out to me not saying let all go free range parent but finding the balance is so hard so before react ask myself few things am reacting out of my own anger is she going to understand this reaction she 2y4m is this helpful or harmful to her in fear of reacting poorly taking few moments can really help back yourself down we all get angry but how we react to that anger is very much in our control if we can just take few extra moments it wonderful that you re recognizing the behaviors you want to change is short term therapy an option ve found it really helpful to gain tangible tools to break the toxic cycle instead of hearing just try harder hearing so this is likely why you behave this way and here are some things you can actually do to change your mindset perspective and behavior if finances are deterrent some therapists will offer reduced rates or even free therapy if you explain your situation to them ve read janet lansbury and really liked her approach but what really helped me was seeing it modeled watched daniel tiger with my son and try and think what would daniel tiger parents do find my kid respond better to that approach than any approach just couple of suggestions give yourself time out when you feel yourself losing control got this idea from my oldest who actually attempted to put me in time out one day when did do what he wanted apologize to your son when you screw up tell him you re learning just like he is and everybody makes mistakes by doing this you re actively teaching him how to handle it when he messes up try try again the best thing is that you re trying not to repeat the mistakes of the past he two do feel like you ve screwed him up forever every time you lose it because you have he literally will not remember any of this kids are really forgiving wow wow wow can believe there are people out there like me had this constant problem went straight to anger every time my kids did something my reaction was anger that how it was growing up thought it was bloody normal until my son told me he wanted to kill himself this was wake up call for me to realise the toxic person wow like you did mindfulness but didn realise it was mindfulness just thought had to change smoked whole lot of weed and mediated and went back to my childhood to feel how felt when my parents spoke to me like that and because could feel again when ever they do something now calmer because it reminds me of me keep saying to your self every time your child does something that irritates you how would you want to feel would want support love or anger keep going xx don have ton of experience with this as parent but just as person who wanted to stop toxic behaviors learned from my parents can say enough good things about talk therapy even for just short while mine recommended some books to read like the dance of anger and helped me realize that being parent to my own kids can be healing thing the fact that you recognize you want to be different is huge do have any great advice other than keep being aware of yourself and keep working on it want to say thank you for posting though because working through the exact same thing right this moment and needed to remember this right now boy do feel this come from an angry family and my preferred method was to hit am so tempted to hit slap spank my son in anger if it gets bad put him in his room to give me chance to cool down recognized my anger issues before my son was born and attend therapy and used to attend celebrate recovery also when react poorly and do say something to my son that shouldn tell my husband every single time no matter how ashamed feel if kept it secret it would be easier to escalate knowing that have the potential to be toxic parent keeps me on my toes and constantly working on my issues yes to daniel for sure daniel tiger is made way that helps kids and parents simultaneously by modeling for both sets label emotions and model working through them as has been said but also make sure my kids know that you can feel angry and love someone at the same time love you all the time is something try to say lot and usually add even if mad or sad or feeling anything else yes that last line is super important what podcasts do you recommend my dad occasionally lost his temper and yelled at or smacked me and he always did this have zero hard feelings toward him about it because of the way he handled it second both parenting from the inside out and seeing therapist my parents both had tempers and were horrible at regulating emotions and have been working through the same troubles as my child has been getting older that book was so insightful and therapy has been invaluable just wanted to drop in and say identify with this post more than any other post ve read thanks for asking you are not alone in this not the only one constantly thinking what would daniel tiger parents do there are dozens of us dozens thank you for commenting this have issues myself after very abusive childhood but always always always have explained it to my son like this and have come very long way but knowing that he might not hate me when he older really helps find tend to yell when feel like have no other option maybe it would be helpful to go back over the circumstances that lead to you yelling and think up different response for next time like him headbutting you you could put him down and tell him you hurt me wo play with you if you hurt me or whatever makes sense have plan in place rather than trying to deal with the emotions after they ve surfaced best of luck you re already doing better than your mom by doing this self examination and reaching out for help lt my aunt had similar problem with my cousin she saw counselor and it helped them dramatically it hard to be good parent when good parenting was modeled for you find myself falling into the parenting techniques my parents used fortunately for me they were mostly good parents especially during the younger years honestly went on antidepressants when noticed that rage building in myself didn have to stay on them for super long time but long enough for me to practice some of my parental coping strategies so they come to me more easily now that no longer on the meds and my depression anxiety is controlled without meds again that very good for me to hear hopefully for op too janet lansbury unruffled is good one used to have raging temper had started to fix myself just by yelling go to your room it got them away from me still yelled it so not great there but at least had moment to step back from myself and they did have to stay nearby and get yelled at sometimes it took forever sometimes just had to cry for while because was so angry now when feel my temper rising tell them to go to their room but it so much more calm now because ve had lot of practice there was also lot of apologizing from me to the kids lot of promising to do better lot of tears and when they started showing temper lot of conversation about how they did like it when *i* yelled how they were making whoever they were yelling at feel bad like had made them feel bad how they could do better than me and did want them to make the same mistakes lots of work but worth it to have peace in our home now also maybe talk to your doctor there are lots of things that can make temper worse like anxiety pmdd depression etc and getting those addressed can make the hard work little easier and frankly if you make it to the end of the day and all you did was not yell that huge take the win my dad was open with us that his father had been abusive and he was trying hard not to be the same way could see how much it hurt him and how much he loved us even as child and remember reassuring him he was and still is good dad and he loving grandfather third parenting from the inside out listening to it as an audio book is great too it gets real honest and in there about what trauma is and what it can look like and exactly how person who experiences something traumatic in their childhood goes and does the same thing to their own children it also does great job of not just explaining but providing actual steps to work through the issues also think if one has the time and resources that working with therapist is great idea dozens thousands daniel tiger mr rogers has made huge impact on thousands of people if not millions from what ve read the key is to talk about the episode with your little one that what makes it stick lots of great advice here sending you love and hugs you re on the right path dude yes feel this so much there are times when shocked by how reacted to my kids behaviour am so scared of turning into my mom but if find myself doing something that maybe wasnt the best or felt too much like my mom talk with my kid about it started when she was young like maybe of course using simple language and not against apologizing to my kid snapped at her real loud one day because she was pretending to be cat and tied her belt around her neck as her collar it scared me so much that she could tie something around her neck even in pretend play definitely yelled at her and told her to never do it again she was upset because of how upset was about it when calmed down explained to her why was upset and apologized for yelling at her it was actually an amazing bonding moment we ve had few moments where did necessarily like my behaviour towards her and let her know afterward big part of it was me telling her was going to try to learn from it and change my behaviour just like ask her to do when she gets in trouble removed these comments say it all but thanks for posting this this is me my dad could really control his temper and now have hard time knowing how to raise my kids differently want them to know how to work through big feelings so now learning as an adult thank you for posting my daughter is only months old sometimes ca control my temper and yell at her realized just couple days ago that could end up being like my dad and it scared me the comments here are helping me feel not so alone and see that there way to break out of this if work on myself brought this up to my therapist and she recommended the book parenting from the inside out https www amazon com parenting inside out self understanding anniversary dp 039916510x https www amazon com parenting inside out self understanding anniversary dp 039916510x therapist who works with parents and children this falls under the category of attachment issues your parents passed on crummy attachment relationship to you and so your blueprint for parent child relationships is what you want it is changeable but takes good amount of work suggest attachment focused emdr af emdr emdr is an amazing technique that heals trauma and af emdr deals specifically with healing trauma in the attachment blueprints person is drawing from others mentioned parenting from the inside out and it is fantastic circle of security is also good as well as the positive parenting program triple dbt also works well in learning tools to get control over your emotions the emdr heals the root cause of things and the others teach tools to cope in healthier ways if you like help finding therapist near you that specializes in this love to help if finances are an issue there are lots of sliding scale community counseling centers but this type of issue does tend to resolve on its own really really recommend therapy you can save your daughter from all the pain your parents put you through think of it as investing in her wellbeing and future can tell you having mom who sets healthy emotional tone for her life is as valuable as other costs like quality childcare or college spread this everywhere everyone with little kids should know about the daniel tiger for parents app all the songs video clips and bonus stuff for parents available for android and apple would suggest looking up some videos that teach you to cope with your anger in the moment of your frustrations perhaps also look into gentle parenting videos to look for alternatives to dealing with tantrums they re supposed to yeild amazing emotional results almost immediately for you **and** baby try writing down your goals even tiny ones like will not raise my voice today as you are more likely to succeed after writing down your goals above all be forgiving of your son and of yourself remind your son that he is still loved by you after his tantrums did the same thing but for me it was little bear was 12 when my little brother was born so we watched that show all the time and the reruns when my son was born really want to live up to the probably unrealistic standard that little bear mother set this is me too had therapist once tell me that if parents were perfect the kid would be crazy how can kid make sense of chaotic world and their role in it if their home life and parents were completely perfect if hadn had years of psychotherapy starting when my daughter who is now was about think be way worse off get in some consistent psychodynamic psychotherapy asap so you can spend your kiddo early years unpacking all your childhood abuse and working on changes to your perception of yourself and others the irony is that you think all that anxiety and beating yourself up would be motivation to change and raise your child differently but the fact is all that emotional emptiness your parents left you with is going to rear its head during all those thankless moments of parenting parenting requires so much personal self confidence we have to be filled up emotionally as best we can so that we aren filled with anger and pain when all that thankless parenting compounds—every time we work hard as hell for our kids only for them to push back on us and act unappreciative it natural and we find ourselves resenting them at least start with being transparent with your child every time you make mistake come back apologize and explain what you did wrong and how you plan to work on it your child learns how to do the same for themselves they learn that mistakes don make us bad people it how we respond to them oh my grandma would watch that everyday before picking my sister up from school never understood why now do it was mr rogers with us always grandma was born with all the patience in the world all day long lol hey you re not alone in this my mom and step dad had ridiculously high expectations of me one memory often refer to is that whenever come home with report my dad would say only 85 why do you know 15 of your work my mom was also really hard on me about everything from school personal goals the thickness of my thighs etc now mom of two boys and ve tried very hard to not have such high expectations because believe me it made me so much harder on myself especially as an adult the thing is life has funny sense of humor and ve been gifted with children who do really want to keep up with the normal milestones both my boys do really talk well they re intelligent beyond belief but their words are very clear my eldest son would go to the potty until he was nearing and he still prefers to sleep in our room on mattress find myself lashing out when get frustrated because ca always understand my eldest kid or because he struggles with basic things but remember how small my mom made me feel and try better next time do always get it right and usually the last hour before their bedtime is my worst but as moms we are just trying our best while our children challenge us therapy can help like your parenting mojo and we turned out okay wow thank you for the suggestion have heard of emdr but would know the first place to go ve already had issues this past month trying to get an intake appointment at place ve already been patient and my insurance is just state but if you have place in mind where could start that search would greatly appreciate some guidance how to talk so little kids will listen and two thousand kisses day are both really great books for this working through exactly the same struggles at the moment so thank you for this post the fact we have even realised there is problem makes us much better parents also very grateful for all these comments some great tips and advice thank you so much for writing this post you re not alone thank you for this am struggling so much with being more open and honest my dad lost his temper lot when was growing up never hurt me but would throw objects and break things in frustration he always apologized after and explained why he lost his temper had very volatile emotions as well and would really escalate things by yelling and slamming stuff back still do that sometimes have good relationship with my father as an adult we appreciate our similarities now rather than butting heads so much like we did when was younger screamed at the dog the other day when she ate diaper and and some other dangerous things the screaming harpy sound that my child made to mimic me made me realize need to not do that do really sound like that the easiest thing would be to hold yourself accountable my wife and have short tempers and no filters respectively when it comes to our kids being annoying violent etc so we go off on them pretty frequently whenever either of us does or says something to our kids that may not be completely ok we have an understanding between us two that the other parent calmly interjects without dismissing their authority in more appropriate way this way we can get the same behavior result without having to resort to being mean and we are able to maintain united front so our kids do see either of us as the mean parent side note our toddler has recently taken to shouting meanie whenever she mad at someone lol the psychology today website can help you find local therapist who does emdr ve found it very helpful there couple things can suggest first you can call your insurance and kindly but firmly ask for provider list with emdr therapists they may try to railroad you into something but if it is seeing someone trained in emdr in the next few weeks kindly but firmly ask to speak to supervisor or for social worker or advocate to help you get appropriate mental healthcare in timely manner other keywords to mention are unable to function normally in everyday life second you can look on psychologytoday com https psychologytoday com and look for therapist by filtering for your insurance and emdr this is variable by area it may turn up some great leads or basically nothing third you can go to 211 com https 211 com and look for mental healthcare they will have links to local mental health centers most of which will either take state insurance or have serious sliding scale you will likely have better time finding emdr therapists if you look in women shelters domestic violence focused centers you can also look into if you qualify for coverage from the victim compensation fund it varies by area so google victim compensation fund your area and see what comes up ive got the same problem found when it comes to stuff like that is to walk away when it comes to bad behavior itll teach them that you will not give attention to it and you get moment to breathe and collect yourself like if you see red just step into another room as they get older explain that when you get upset you breathe to calm down it also helps them learn to control their emotions and explain the emotion your feeling mommy is angry because you wont stop pulling her hair and it hurts very much or mommy feels sad because shes tired op here ve read every single comment and am so grateful for the excellent advice and recommendations even more notably am comforted to know not alone in my struggle thank you all hello my mom who raised three kids alone never ever lost her temper yelled punished nor hit us not once crumbled in guild and self hate if misbehaved and she *sighed* or raised disapproving eyebrow she was approving and patient too but felt her so cold distant untouchable she was subtly controlling and left us very little intimacy for our protection puberty was horrible tried everything to get her to simply react show any bad emotion show her feelings she still struggling with that at well over 60yo struggle lot with keeping my cool with the kids but kind of get her now that also raise my kids alone still resent her for some things but the sheer effort she made was barely human realize now apologize sorry mommy got too mad was scared you were going hurt my nose but yelled too loud sorry it simple but think it really important and think it really means something even to yo it models apologizing for them and it repairs your relationship also really cherish my children responses when give them genuine apology it just feels healthy
